fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11691].
  {panel}

This works as a Sub-Filter:
((fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() AND fixVersion != "Facelift Kurios" AND fixVersion != "Facelift adresshantering" AND fixVersion != "Future version") OR fixVersion is EMPTY) AND (resolution != "Won't Fix" or resolution is empty)

But not this:
((fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() AND fixVersion != "Facelift Kurios" AND fixVersion != "Facelift adresshantering" AND fixVersion != "Future version" and fixVersion!="Facelift Drag and Drop") OR fixVersion is EMPTY) AND (resolution != "Won't Fix" or resolution is empty)
fields.summary: Work Sub-Filter can't be saved when the string is 273 chars or more.

fields.description: As a user, it would be great to have an ability to measure Days in Column by year, month or week (instead of one day, as it is by default)
fields.summary: Ability to configure Days in Column measurement

fields.description:
Currently if only one status is mapped to a column on JIRA Agile board the underlying or target status is not displayed while transitioning to that column.

It would be great we can have the status shown here as well, so that the user is aware of the status that he is transitioning to.

Example:
!agiletransition.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display the target Status when dragging to a Single status column

fields.description: Seeing the collapsed Kanban board can be very useful; however, it is not possible to see the current flow by column and swim lane.  Please consider adding subtotals for rows and columns within the collapsed view.  Proposed image attached.
fields.summary: Show subtotals for swimlanes in kanban board columns

fields.description: It would be great if we can have the ability to filter an Agile board via last activity date. This is useful for instances with huge number of boards to make it easier to identify which board is currently in use.
fields.summary: Last Updated Date for Agile Board Filtering

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I'd like to turn off email notifications for changes made to the issue rank in order to stop unnecessary emails.

Situation:
Our Product Owners changes the order of stories in the backlog, thus changing the "rank" field of stories. This causes emails to watchers of those tickets. It seems that changing the rank is a generic event, just like changing the user story. I'd like to configure the notification scheme so that rank changes do not cause notifications.
fields.summary: Disable email notification for changes to issue rank

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11680].
  {panel}

h2.How to Reproduce
* Install JIRA and JIRA Agile 6.6.51.
* Create an agile board.
* Access the board and copy the URL. The URL would look like {{$JIRA_BASE_URL/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=348&view=planning}}
* Access the board configuration and copy the configuration URL for the board {{$JIRA_BASE_URL/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=348&tab=columns}}
* Delete the board.
* Try to access the URL again.


h2.Expected result
A message saying the board does not exist. Since lot of users share a board, when users access a non-existent board, they might think that there is some bigger database problem.


h2.Actual result
An error message "Error - rapidViewId"
!GHS_Error_rapidviewid.png!
fields.summary: Error rapidViewId when trying to access non-existent board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11679].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Occurs for users with Opt-in for new side bar feature.
# Access Agile Board.
# Also Effected by Bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-11672
# Cannot navigate away from overview of a single project using Project Drop-down navigation menu. 

*Info for Atlassian*
Have {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Switch}} or {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation}} dark feature activated.

*Diagnosis*
- Launch JavaScript console 
- You will see the following error generated when trying to navigate to new project (See Screenshot):
{code}
GET http://<YOUR INSTANCE NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel?rapidViewID=unified& =<Some Number Set> 404 (not Found)
{code}


h1.Resolution:
- File A support Request at https://support.atlassian.com
- we will need to schedule a restart of your service.
fields.summary: Cannot Navigate away From Project Receive 404 JS error

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a project created with multiple workflow statuses
# Have an Agile board for this project (Kanban or Scrum)
# Map more than one status per column
E.g.:
!Screen Shot 2015-01-15 at 11.58.51 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Have one issue on a status which column has one or more status mapped
E.g.:
!Transition.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Results:*
# An option to transition the issue from 'In Progress' to 'In Review' should show up with options to 'To Do' and to 'Done'. Each status should appear as a separate section with a dashed outline.
Workflow:
!Screen Shot 2015-01-15 at 1.24.51 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Actual Results:*
# The system only shows the options to transition it to 'To Do' and 'Done'.

*Workaround:*
Open the issue on another tab or in the issue view detail and transition the issue via the workflow buttons.

*Notes:*
[Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Transitioning+an+Issue] states that:
bq. When you start dragging an issue, you can only transition the issue to columns whose background turns blue. When the issue is hovered over the target column, the blue background turns green.

bq. If the target column is associated with more than one status then, when the issue is hovered over that column, each status will appear as a separate section with a dashed outline (see Screenshot 2 below). Complete the transition to the appropriate status by dropping the issue onto the section of the column.
fields.summary: Transition issue to different status within the same column does not work

In Work mode (JIRA Agile) when you click on a Sprint there is no way to remove the image (by clicking outside of the Sprint or clicking on the Sprint button). You have to refresh the page to get the Sprint info screen to go away.

fields.description:
This is directly related to the bug ticket JRA-41578. Whenever users with a space in their username is trying to access the Agile boards (in JIRA 6.3.13), the board will keep refreshing.

The current workaround is to rename the user, but for environments where the username cannot be renamed (external user management, for example), this is a *blocker* as the Agile boards cannot be used at all.
fields.summary: Agile boards will keep refreshing for users with a space in their username

fields.description: Populates  the 'Unestimated Stories' in the backlog list for user reference.
fields.summary: View 'Unestimated Stories' in the backlog list (Plan mode)

fields.description:
Currently we can see all the issues inside an Epic directly in the boards or in the Epic itself vis the "Issues in Epic" section of the View Issue screen.

It would be great if we could add a column to the Issue Navigator displaying all the issues inside an Epic. This way we could filter containing all the Epics in a project and have all the issues inside the filtered Epics displayed all in one place.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to be able to display an "Issues in Epic" column (Epic Link) in the Issue Navigator
Unable to navigate to Plan and Work mode when the new side bar feature is enabled

fields.description: As as user I only want to see fields on the cards which are not empty.
fields.summary: Display card layout fields only when they are not empty.

fields.description:
Currently (Agile 6.6.51), I can only change order of sub-tasks in any of my story.
However, I can't to change the order of swimlanes, e.g. to move them higher or lower.
Please add such ability.

I'm using Kanban board with swimlanes based on "Stories"
fields.summary: Need ability to change order of Story swimlanes

fields.description: Similar to how JIRA Agile will generate a card color scheme based on issue type, priority, or assignee, offer a color scheme based on workflow status.
fields.summary: Card colors based on workflow status

fields.description:
Currently, with JIRA Agile, sub-tasks can only be tied to one parent and that parent can only be assigned to one Sprint.

The ideal situation would be to include the ability to either assign the issue to a particular Sprint (currently supported) OR allow the issue to "Inherit Sprint from Sub-Tasks" (proposed new option). Also, if the "Inherit Sprint from Sub-Tasks" option is selected, the sub-task not the parent issue is included on the Agile board. The Parent issue simply keeps record of the progress of all subtasks. 

With this option, each sub-task could be assigned a Sprint. The estimation added to the Subtask would then be rolled up to the Parent based on the Sprint the "In Progress" subtask is currently assigned. This would allow Parent issues to be tracked across more than one sprint.
fields.summary: Assign Sprints to Subtasks and Parent Reflects Current Subtask Sprint Estimation

fields.description:
When a new issue is created, there's an option to link it to an existing epic via the Epic Link field. In this case, there're chances that the issue is mistakenly linked to a Done epic, which will then make it invisible in Plan mode of a Scrum board when the Epic filter "Issues without epics" is selected.

Suggestion is to hide Done epics or make them unselectable from the Epic Link field so that new issues can only be linked to active epics.
fields.summary: Done Epics should not be available/selectable in Epic Link field

fields.description:
Currently, there is no documentation about deleting a board that contains information such as who can delete a board, is there any log that will keep board deletion event etc.

It would be great if those information are available or perhaps adding it to [Creating a board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Creating+a+Board].
fields.summary: Adding board deletion documentation page

fields.description: This is for issuing pay slip working in  various department of the organization.
fields.summary: Payroll Management System

fields.description:
This is project that manages the records of the students.
In this project we  are having 5 modules such as Student Records, Notification,
Attendance,Exam Schedule,Fee Structure.
fields.summary: Student Record Management System

fields.description:
This is another issue where there are many inconsistencies in Jira's Reports section.  
Steps to Reproduce:
View any completed Sprint in the "Sprint Report" section of the Reports tab.
Under the "Completed Issues" section at the top of the Status Report, view the Story Points completed number on the right hand side.
Above that number, click the blue  hyperlink "View in Issue Navigator" 
On the Issue Navigaor screen choose to Export the report to Excel
Sum the story points in the Done column of the report.
They will NOT match up the Sprint Report completed points.  

This happens to all of my Sprints that have any scope changes after the Sprint begins: Eg. stories are added or taken away, there are sizing changes, etc
There is no consistent apples to apples comparison amongst the reporting screens, even within one reporting screen.  
Can you reproduce this error on your end?  Thank you.
fields.summary: Sprint Report: Completed Issues Story Points do NOT match the story points in Done status when the report is viewed in Issue Navigator and exported

fields.description: The Sprint Report will show an asterisk next to backlog items that were added to the sprint after the start of the sprint, which is helpful, however, there is no way of parsing these out, or identifying them easily once you view the Sprint Report in the Issue Navigator.  Being able to do this would be very useful for tracking new issues added to a Sprint, especially when exporting the data to an Excel document.  Thank you.
fields.summary: Ability to Sort & Export "Issues added to sprint after start time" from Sprint Report to Issue Navigator screen

fields.description: The Burndown Chart within the Reports tab of Jira Agile has a feature that nicely lists the Sprint's daily burndown. If an issue is a scope change (added or removed to a sprint) and if an issue is completed, and thus, burn downed.  However, there is no way to view this in the Issue Navigator Format.  Why not?  It would be very helpful to export this list to Excel, like you can do in the "Sprint Report."
fields.summary: Apply "View In Issue Navigator" option to Burndown Chart within Reports tab

fields.description:
Following from issues GHS-4136 and GHS-4139, I would like to request a variant of the same thing, which hopefully won't be rejected as well :-)
We would also like to support the burndown of story points but without either linking to real time or editing the story point field. A solution that would be suitable for us, and hopefully for others, would be to offer a burndown chart, which shows under the existing curve a stacked area coloured according to the states of the non-completed issues. One would just have to be able to define a colour for each state in the board configuration and then Jira agile could do the rest. Essentially this amounts to a fusion of a cumulative flow diagram with a burndown chart as shown here using the example created by Steve Lane (three states, A, B and C, and 4 issues with 2, 7, 5 and 3 story points respectfully, progressing through the states from A to Done):

!char_proposal2.png!

Original request was:

{noformat}
Following from issues GHS-4136 and GHS-4139, I would like to request a variant of the same thing, which hopefully won't be rejected as well :-)
We would also like to support the burndown of story points but without either linking to real time or editing the story point field. A solution that would be suitable for us, and hopefully sufficiently flexible for others, would be to define partial burndown percentages for the intermediate columns. E.g. one could define an intermediate state/column "development complete - in testing" and associate the column with 70% burndown (with "complete" in the final column for the usual 100%). This wouldn't be 100% correct but at least more accurate and reflect some progress. If one could define the burndown % for any intermediate column in such a way in the board configuration then users could define as many partial burndown states as they wish for the granularity they seek. Clearly the result is that the burndown chart (and respective reports) would apply the respective partial burndown of the issues' SP as they progress through the different intermediate states.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Story point burn down by state transition - Sprint Cumulative Flow Diagram

fields.description: It would be great if we can have a sprint based option to filter Agile boards.
fields.summary: Filter Option Based on Specific Sprint for Agile Boards

fields.description: It seems to be impossible to rename a version at the moment. Also, if i choose to add a description to the version it doesn't get set. On page refresh all changes to these fields are reset.
fields.summary: Version re-name bug

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to have a functionality whereby. old sprints can be archived. These Sprints should not be visible in the drop down or the reports unless explicitly included by user.
fields.summary: Archive Old Spints

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to have the ability to disassociate a set of issues from a Completed Sprint without having to manually edit the Sprint field of the issues.
fields.summary: Removing an Issue from a Completed Sprint

fields.description: As the current behaviour for moving issue that is in a running sprint will still retain the previous Sprint values, it would be great if JIRA could give a warning to let the user know. As it could be confusing when an issue that is not coming out in the board still counted on the filter or reports later.
fields.summary: Warning when moving out an issue that is included in an active sprint

fields.description:
Previous summary: {{Moving Issue to Another Project would retain the Sprint ID.}}


*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a dummy Project A.
# Create a new Board with a New Project B.
# Create a several issues and a sprint.
# Include the issues in the sprint.
# Move one of the issue to the Project A.
# The issue will be removed from the board(Plan and Work).
# Go to issue navigator and search for issue that is based on Project B Sprint ID.

*Expected Results*:
As the issue is being moved to another project which is out of the Board filter scope, the issue would not listed out.

*Actual Results*:
The issue will also shown on the issue navigator.

*Notes*:
* If the Sprint Field is included in the "View Issue" screen, the Sprint name will be there.
* As the issue is already out of the board filter scope, the Sprint Field should have its value cleared.
fields.summary: Warn when issues in a sprint are being moved outside of the current board's filter

fields.description: When using the scrum board, I would like to be able to drag an issue to a new status in the same column, this is currently not possible.
fields.summary: Dragging issue to other status in same column

fields.description:
Currently the Burndown chart splits the axis in a fixed amount of intervals based on the duration of the sprint.

If a sprint is very small (e.g. 3 days) the X axis displays intervals of 4 hours.

It would be great if we could specify the interval for the axis so we could have the axis displayed on intervals of 1 day, for example.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to be able to customize the axis on the Burndown Chart

fields.description:
Ability to configure the avatar in the card based on different user picker field in different column. Example:
* Column A - Assignee
* Column B - Assignee
* Column C - User Picker Field 1
* Column D - User Picker Field 2
fields.summary: As a Board Admin, I would like to configure card Avatar based on column.

fields.description:
When using the Agile Scrum board in Jira, I want to see the “summary count” of the remaining open issues, in the collapsed (and expanded) view of the Epics tab.

To calculate the “summary count” I’m referring to, use this math…
“Issues” – “Completed” = “summary count”

*Problem*: Right now, I need to click on each Epic individually to see the summary count in the Backlog view and cannot get an overview of the summary count of all Epics at a glance.

*Request*: Add a summary count numeric field exactly like the current ones, but at the top between the Epic name and the colored pull-down option/arrow (to the left of the colored pull-down). See mock-up below.
This would make this information available without clicking on Epics individually. The summary counts would also be visible without having to expand the Epics themselves, giving you an overview of how big each Epic is at a glance. This would be extremely useful when managing/grooming several Epics at the same time.

Please look at attached image for an example of what this would look like…
fields.summary: Add summary count to Epics

fields.description: GHS-7874 made the detail view resizable for the plan tab.  I would like to be able to resize the detail view for the work tab as well.
fields.summary: Resizable Detail View - Work Tab

fields.description:
As JIRA Agile Administrator, I would like to export the current view of my board, "Work", "Report" or "Plan" to be shared via email.

I could be directly an export via email, or a PDF/Excel export, so the view could be easily attached in an email to be shared outside the system.
fields.summary: Ability to export Board.

fields.description:
When a user edits the sprint field directly in the JIRA issue, we should limit the result set there to only sprints on boards where the issue meets the criteria to be placed into the sprint.

If this is accepted, we need to consider the performance penalty of making this kind of a check.
fields.summary: Limit results in sprint field to sprints the issue could actually join

fields.description: It would be nice to have Epic swimlanes display the Epic Issue Type on the swimlane, and especially useful to have the Issue Key displayed as well (as a hyperlink).  This would have Epic swimlanes display similarly to Story swimlanes, which seems to make sense as they are both issue types in JIRA.  Currently there is no convenient way to jump to the Issue Summary View of an Epic from a board where Epics are being used as swimlanes.
fields.summary: Epic swimlanes should display Issue Type and Issue Key

fields.description:
Users that integrate JIRA with Confluence will want a dynamic way to report on Release planning to their teams. If the info from the Release Burndown chart was displayed in a gadget, this would make it easier for them.

From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11966973/how-do-you-see-release-burndown-in-a-gadget
fields.summary: Create gadget for release burndown chart
Incorrect date/time format in Scrum Project Sprint header

fields.description:
From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11965828/apply-context-to-sprint-field

{quote}So, it appears that the default functionality for options/selections displayed in the Sprint field are recommended sprints (ones which you have recently viewed) followed by all other sprints in the instance (unless user begins typing the name of a sprint they want, at which point autofill will suggest sprints accordingly). 

Is there a way to apply context to the Sprint field so that only sprints associated with a board in which the issue would be viewed are selectable?  I have a user who says people are adding sprints to an issue that don't apply (as they belong to a board that the issue would not be displayed on), and this is messing things up.{quote}

It would be nice if this was the default behavior, or possibly something that the JAG admin can toggle?
fields.summary: Autocomplete for sprint field should only show boards where the issue appears

fields.description: When the swimlanes is set to assignee, it will be great to have the drag and drop feature to assign the assignee to the ticket.
fields.summary: Having Drag and Drop feature to set assignee when Swimlanes is based on Assignee

fields.description:
When using the JIRA Agile simplified workflow, which uses the feature "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" in the workflow causes a problem with the "Resolution" value of the issues. If an issue has been resolved but needs to be reopened, the resolution is not cleared out and in order to make it work, we have to modify the whole workflow and stop using the JIRA Agile simplified workflow.

We would to add a feature that will setup this behavior correctly out of the box when a new JIRA Agile simplified workflow is created.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Simplify workflow does not reset "Resolution" field value when reopening issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11617].
  {panel}

In the case where balancing has split the issues between two buckets e.g.

0|MIN
0|BBB
1|AAA
1|MAX

If a user tries to insert an issue between 0|BBB and 1|AAA the operation will fail with "Between works only within the same bucket".  If balancing is in progress, its possible that the issue can resolve itself.  However if balancing is in a half way state and not running, the operation will fail.

Theoretically you should just be able to use genNext() in these cases rather than throwing the exception.
fields.summary: Inserting an issue at the lexorank bucket boundary could fail

fields.description:
Our team use a physical board with sticky notes of different color to indicate the card types (bug, story, etc).

The same cards are maintained in JIRA Agile where we have replicated the colors based on issue type, using the board options page. However the JIRA issue type icons (have a different color scheme) still show - making the board a more confusing collection of colors.

Suggest to add a board option to hide the issue type icon to improve readability.
fields.summary: As an agile board admin, I want to be able to hide the issue type icons from appearing on cards on the board.

fields.description:
Currently, for someone to have the ability to start/close sprints, JIRA requires the following. 
1) The project is specified in the filter query for the board.
2) User has administrator rights to the project.

We would prefer that we don't specify a project filter for the board. This is useful when teams are working on multiple projects. Instead of adding all the projects to the filter and granting users Administrator access to all those projects, we would like to specify just the Team in the filter. This means any issue assigned to the team would show up on their board irrespective of the project. It would be nice if we had a separate permission to open/close sprints rather than making someone an administrator and requiring the projects in the filter.
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't require Project Administrator permissions for starting/closing sprints

fields.description: Under *Board > Configure > Columns*, issue counts for each status are displayed. They account for all issues in a particular status, returned by the board filter - including subtask issue types. This can be misleading, especially for the _Plan_ mode, where subtasks won't be displayed and it'll seem as if there are issues missing from the board.
fields.summary: Issue count in column configuration shouldn't include subtasks

fields.description: We would like to have a workload summary feature in the Kanban boards, similar to what was implemented in the Scrum board. The idea is to be able to see at a glance how many tickets someone is working on. Becuase Kanban does not do planning, this should be available in the Work mode.
fields.summary: Add workload summary feature to Kanban board similar to Scrum

fields.description: Add some kind of feedback telling a user why they don't have permission to start a sprint. If a board contains issues from 20 projects, checking them all independently is a complex task. It would be better for the user to contact their JIRA Admin and ask for specific permission changes to occur.
fields.summary: If a user does not have permission to start a sprint, tell them why

fields.description:
Preconditions
Иметь установленное программное обеспечение "Диетический калькулятор" на устройтве

1. Запускаем программу "Диетический калькулятор"

Actual results

fields.summary: Возможность добавления выбора цифры в поле поиска

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce: 
# On JIRA Agile, copy a board
# Notice that the Administrators field is empty and it has not been copied to the new board.

h4. Expected behavior:
All fields of the board should have been copied including the Administrators field.

h4.Workarround:
A JIRA administrator can configure the board and add the desired admins for the board.
fields.summary: Copy board does not copy administrator

fields.description: It would be great if we can have the ability to highlight a specific swim-lane with a different color to indicate urgency of issues.
fields.summary: Highlight a Swimlane to indicate Urgency of issues

fields.description:
When an Agile Board is deleted, future sprints for the board are still listed in the sprint drop down.

There is no way to remove these sprints once the board has been deleted,  and they continue to appear in the suggestions list for sprints.

h2. Workaround
# Create a new board.
# Associate the filter of deleted board to new board.
(i) The default filter query for the board is normally something like:project = "NAME OF THE PROJECT" ORDER BY Rank ASC
# You can now end sprint from this board or remove the sprint(s).
fields.summary: When an Agile Board is deleted, future sprints for the board are still listed in the sprint drop down

fields.description:
Copied from JPO project:  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPO-152

We often create a sprint label in Jira-Agile (press the create sprint button) in order to plan stories in for the forthcoming sprint. Then we drop there stories in which we plan to do in the next sprint. Sometimes until the planning startes the planned stories will be removed from the non started sprint or the sprint label will be empty. The problem is: The non started sprint labels could then not be removed and Jira gives following feedback : This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status. Is there a possibility to delete this labels?
fields.summary: Agile: Created sprint flag could not be deleted

fields.description:
My suggestion is an option for compact cards in Work mode.

I recently worked at a place in a team of 6 people where we had our stand-ups by a 60-inch 1080p screen. A lot, if not most, of the time was spent scrolling back and forth to find the issue we were talking about. (The sudden appearance of the details view also seems to consistently confuse people.) The place I'm at now has the same issue and has even chosen not to use Jira Agile for stand-ups for this very reason, which I think is tragic.

Cards as they are now in the (non-classic) Work view have a lot of empty space in all our scrum boards. The sizes of cards in Plan mode however is very compact, and contains enough information for the team to know what it concerns. 

I believe people are still using post-its everywhere because a sprint will not fit in a readable manner in one screen.
fields.summary: Compact cards in Work View

fields.description:
If an user renames 'In progress' to 'IN PROGRESS' (and probably other system statuses), and then they create a new project using the 'Agile Software Development' types, this will create a Workflow with missing statuses (which is invalid).

This will create a number of errors in other parts of JIRA, like NPE when creating a board involving those projects.
fields.summary: Renaming system statuses yields to invalid workflows created using 'Agile Simplified Workflow'

fields.description:
Kanban board columns group together several workflow statuses. It would be nice to be able to re-use this mapping in a JQL function e.g. in {{issueInBoardColumn("board name", "board column")}}. This will simplify queries now having to include long clauses based on status field.

The same idea could also be expanded to create a calculated custom field to have the current kanban column of an issue as a field in issue navigator.
fields.summary: JQL function and API to select issues on a kanban board column

fields.description: As a Scrum Board (Plan View) user, I would like to have a third option in the left margin to expand a Component column that behaves just like the Epic and Version columns. That way, I can click on a component and the board will be filtered on that component, just like it does for Epics and Versions.
fields.summary: Components on Scrum Board - Plan View

fields.description:
As a scrum or kanban board user, I would like to be able to transition my issues between statuses that are mapped to the same column so that I don't have to use the workflow controls to do the transition.

In JIRA Agile v6.6.0, if multiple statuses are mapped to a column, it is impossible to transition a story from one status to another in the same column even though there is valid transition.

In my case, I've created a Kanban board with the columns Not Started - Analysis - Development - Testing - UAT - Done. There are two statuses mapped to each of the middle for columns (e.g. Ready for Analysis and In Analysis, Ready for Development and In Development, etc.). I am showing the status on the card layout to eliminate ambiguity. But I can't move the card from "Ready for Analysis" to "In Analysis" with drag and drop. I have to use the workflow controls instead.  Which renders the whole board pretty unusable.
fields.summary: Allow transitions between statuses in same column on Agile Board

fields.description:
INTERNAL USER ASKS:
 
I am trying to execute this query:

status in ("STATUS1", "STATUS2") and fixVersion = "QKB-CI v26" and summary ~ \\-NULL\\-

and it doesn’t work. I am getting issues with –NULL] instead of the ones that I want with -NULL- 

Actually there shouldn’t be any with -NULL- but that is what I want to check for. I have tried various methods to test but it never handles the – correctly. 

I looked online and found this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25092

Do we have the version with the escaped special character fix?

--- OUR ADMIN REPORTED:

We are on 6.3.8, so yes, it should work.
text ~ "\\-NULL\\-"

---USER REPLIES:

Even when I run text ~ "\\-NULL\\-" I get a lot of things that don't have -NULL- (dashNULLdash) in them. They just have NULL.
fields.summary: JQL does not work for -- and summary ~ \\-NULL\\-

fields.description:
As a JIRA-AGILE plugin developer I want to manipulate the listing of stories in the PLAN mode of a SCRUM board to _inject_ a bar representing a release between the stories to get an quick overview over the release-plan.

At the one side there are some stories estimated with story points in my SCRUM backlog.
At the other side I manage releases/versions in JIRA, too.
Each release/version has a *fix release-date*, also stored in JIRA.
The JIRA backlog "PLAN view" is a very great view and my single point of planning. I don't want to do some excel exports etc...

Regarding to the current team velocity it is possible to calculate which stories are able to be "in" a specific version and which not. Nothing new so far...

I want to write a plugin that shows exactly this information in the story list of my backlog. Each version should be placed below the story at most be possible to deliver within this version as a "fake story" or as a bar - see attached example for detail.

*My request*
It would be very nice if you provide some extensions to hook into the enumeration of the stories of the backlog to inject a version-bar between two stories.


*Why I want to develop this?*
In the Product-Owners game there are some issues coming up every day there seems to be _more important_ than the planned issues. That's ok so far - but as a PO i want to keep track which issue will be descoped if I add the new one.
=> In this case the issue above a version will fall below the version bar. This is a great visual feedback.
=> In order to this i'm able to drag&drop another - in the meantime _not so important anymore_ - issue below to bar to make a visual release planning.
fields.summary: As a JIRA-AGILE plugin developer I want to manipulate the listing of stories in the PLAN mode of a SCRUM board

fields.description:

For example:
{noformat}story-1
story-2
------division-1--------
story-3
story-4
------division-2--------
story-5
story-6{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to Add Dividers into Backlog

fields.description:
On agile boards, could we have the option to display parent Stories as a large card (they way they are when they have no sub-tasks), and display their Sub-tasks as smaller 1 row height under them (regardless of whether swimlanes are neabled or disabled).

Currently it's the parent stories that are displayed with only 1 row height (and greyed out) above their sub-tasks.

Benefit: This would make standups around a Jira much more efficient, and the overall progress of stories much clearer (whereas the very granular details of sub-tasks are of less interest during standups - and therefore, it's much easier to expand them when working normally at desk, than having to expand parent stories during standups around a shared big screen).
fields.summary: Display Stories as large cards and sub-tasks as small cards.

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I like what you have done with Jira Agile and  have been impressed by its flexibility.
There are however a few things I would love to see in the software that I feel are missing, unless I have completely missed it.

The first point is, a lot of our work revolves around having the senior members of staff sign off on any work/task. I could not see any way to setting an issue to a delivered state for the issue owner to either accept of reject.

The second point is about the estimation. I understand that user stories use a points based estimation and other issues use a time based estimation. But I would have preferred to have the option to use a points based estimation on issues.

Thank you,

Deepam Trivedi

*Reporter*: Deepam Trivedi
*E-mail*: [mailto:deepam@dialoguebydesign.co.uk]
fields.summary: Jira Agile feedback and improvements

fields.description:
Today the Agile Version Report shows their results based only in one version and one project.

Would be useful if the report could merge data from different projects and versions with the same release date.

This way management with teams working across multiple JIRA projects would be able to see the progress of the entire team in one report.
fields.summary: Create Agile Version Report covering multiple JIRA project versions

fields.description:
Currently Rank only supports Ascending sort order e.g. ORDER BY Rank ASC. If the filter query of a board is updated and DESC is used instead, trying to rank an issue throws this warning message:
bq. (!) Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by Rank. Please check your +filter configuration+.

It's hard to tell from the message whether Rank is disabled or not supported in this case, but the board is actually ordered by Rank. Clicking on "filter configuration" to go to the board config, this message is displayed:
bq. The sort order must be ascending. Descending sort order is not supported.

It would be great if the warning message can be updated, or the page [Enabling Ranking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Enabling+Ranking] should mention that Descending sort order is not supported.
fields.summary: Update warning message when Rank is disabled due to Descending sort order

fields.description:
Personally, I love JIRA Agile. However, we also have some projects within our organization that use Pivotal Tracker, and many employees prefer Pivotal Tracker to JIRA Agile. Here are some things that I have heard Pivotal Tracker does better than JIRA Agile, that I think might get more people (at least within our organization) to use JIRA Agile:

* Separation of backlog vs. icebox. Having everything in the backlog makes it difficult to maintain. Having a concept of an Icebox (features that you don't know are a "go" yet) is a major plus. You *can* configure JIRA Agile to use filters to separate out backlog vs. icebox (perhaps using labels), but it is more difficult than it should be. Backlog and icebox tickets should be a built-in concept, rather than something you have to configure to get working right, and then train users to use correctly.
* Velocity calculation: It is not obvious what the velocity for the project is, and the way that velocity is calculated is not very configurable. The velocity for the project should be right in front of everyone on both the planning and current sprint boards. It wouldn't hurt to have a way for you to see more details on the calculation of the velocity, either.
* Future sprint planning. Pivotal Tracker automatically organizes all tickets in the backlog into sprints for you. You can easily drag-and-drop issues in and out of sprints, but PT doesn't force you to manually create each sprint, it just automatically calculates the next several sprints based on the velocity projected for the project. This is a BIG deal in my mind (being a JIRA agile fan) as well.
* Team member strength in velocity calculation is also a big deal. For us, the teams change regularly, and having a way of indicating that we are not at 100% capacity in team strength, and having that affect the velocity projection is really useful.
* Because JIRA supports customizable fields, I think it would be imortant to have a more advanced configuration screen for the boards to allow the admin of a JIRA project to configure the fields that are shown in the issue lines and the issue details screens. Also, all fields that are on the issue details screen should be editable within JIRA Agile. Having to swap from the JIRA Agile screen to the native JIRA edit screen is *not* intuitive.

That's all I am aware of for now. I hope these suggestions help make JIRA Agile even better. I would love to continue using it.. But, being one of the only ones, I'm fearful I may not be able to forever unless some of these suggestions are addressed.
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker features that make things easy

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
# Created FP-1
# Added to a sprint 
# Started the sprint
# Dragged the issue to _Done_ column
# Completed the sprint
# Viewed the Release Burndown Report, as expected, FP-1 won't show up as it is not associated to any version
# Edited the issue and associate it to version 1.0
# Viewed the Release Burndown Report and it is still not showing.

According to the documentation, [Viewing the Release Burndown|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Release+Burndown], 
{quote}
* Issue completed in a sprint, but only added to the version afterwards:
The issue will be shown on the report, as if it was always part of the version.
{quote}
fields.summary: Release Burndown Chart doesn't show issues added to a version after Sprint Completion
Voyager

fields.description:
Imagine i want to use Control Chart to evaluate cycle time of the issues over time.

Now, some of the issues are *still open* (and hopefully included in _average_ statistics), but the problem is that i cannot evaluate their count and "current" average age from the chart even if current filter is configured to show Open issues.

The request is to introduce an option to include even "non-final" issues in the list - it may be some "one red dot" that would group issues still open, but important is that
* it is clear that such issues' statistics does (or does not - depending on selection?) contribute to overall average (and rolling average) calculation
* current (average) age of such issues is calculated and displayed somewhere on chart (since issues are still open, i would say age = time since creation date)
* there is a way to show list of such issues (i.e. something like green circles with issue clusters for closed ones that has a JQL hyperlink)
fields.summary: Control Chart: option to show Open issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11568].
  {panel}

h4. Summary:
On the *Plan mode* (Scrum board), under a sprint, there is a "create issue" button which will create issue to that particular sprint. The problem happens when there is a required field for issue creation. It will prompt create issue dialog box to enter the required filled, and this steps removes the value of "Sprint field" which previously has been assigned.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to *JIRA Agile plan mode*
# Refer to the inactive sprint
# Refer to *create issue* option on the bottom of that particular sprint
# Enter the issue summary (sprint is automatically assigned to the particular sprint)
!step1.png|thumbnail!
# Click on "create issue" button under that particular sprint
# It will prompt the "create issue" dialog to enter the values for required fields
# The value of sprint becomes NULL (empty)
!step2.png|thumbnail!
# This causes the issue to be created in backlog
!step3.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected Behavior
The value of *Sprint* field should not get removed when it prompts the create issue dialog box

h4. Additional Information
- Occurs in JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13
- This does not occur if there is no required field (which will not prompt create issue dialog box

h4. Workaround
The workaround would be to reenter the sprint value when the create issue dialog box is being prompted.
fields.summary: Required Field causes Sprint value to be NULL when create an issue from Sprint

fields.description:
At the moment, the behavior of the Control Chart is as follows:

Assume you have an issue which has passed through status A, B, C and is currently in the status D. If you select the columns A, B, C and D, the issue will still display in the control chart because it *was* in A, B or C before. If the issue moved across transition accordingly (A > B > C > D) the horizontal displacement of the issue in the chart is the time/date it transitioned out of C because it is the last status it transitioned out of (even though it has not yet transitioned out of D).

It would be better to have it such that if A, B, C and D is selected, the Control Chart will only show the issues once it has passed through *all* A, B, C and D. If the issue is still in D, then it shouldn't show in the Control Chart.
fields.summary: Control Chart behavior for selected columns

fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Control+Chart]

The above documentation states the following
{panel}
As shown on the chart legend, each dot represents an issue or a group (cluster) of issues:
 * The vertical placement of the dot represents the cycle time for the issue, i.e. the 'Elapsed Time'. For a cluster of issues, the dot is placed at the average cycle time for the issues.
 * The horizontal placement indicates when the issue(s) transitioned out of the last status selected on the chart (in Columns). For example, if you are using the JIRA Software Development workflow and have selected 'In Progress' and 'In Review' as the Columns on the Control Chart, the dots will indicate when the issue transitioned out of the 'In Review' status.{panel}
This sometimes gives an impression that issues will only be visible in the Control Chart once they have passed through *all* of the columns selected (in this case, one it passed through *In Progress* and *In Review*).

However, this isn't the case. If the issue is still in *In Review*, it will still be displayed in the Control Chart with the horizontal displacement being when it transitioned out of *In Progress*.

Please update this documentation to better explain the intended behavior of the Control Chart to avoid misunderstanding.

Also there is a typo in the 'configure the time period' callout here; please fix!: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/control-chart-777002660.html
fields.summary: Update Control Chart Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11546].
  {panel}

When users are trying the new project navigation and you're migrating from Cloud to Server, projects have no issues but the Agile boards are broken. 

*Workaround 1* 
1. Download https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser
2. Navigate to the REST API Browser
3. Uncheck 'Show public API'
4. Search for darkfeature
5. Send the "DELETE" request

*Workaround 2*
1. Go to the project(s) related to your board
2. Switch back to the old layout option

fields.summary: New project sidebar broken after migrating to server

fields.description:
I am using Jira on Demand. I tried to bulk edit the sprint (move issues from sprint A to B). I entered the NAME of the sprint in the field shown in the bulk edit dialog. The system crashed with the exception shown below. I later tried it again and entered the sprint id - this worked (and made me very happy ;-)). 

So actually I see two issues:
a) the system should not crash hard, but throw an error message, that my user input is not valid
b) the ui should give me some hint that I may NOT enter the sprint name in this dialog (As far as I can see this is not consistent through the software).

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. fields.summary: Bulk Edit Sprint -> Exception

fields.description:
When creating new projects the JIRA default schemes are no longer selected by default for Agile project types.

To assist with a standard or common scheme for projects, allow the selection of a scheme used by an existing project.
fields.summary: Selection of existing schemes when creating a new project

fields.description:
We use a combination of single issues and parent/subtask issues. Often the parent/subtask issues are used by us to indicate that when working on a change/bug(the parent task) we also tackle some other small issue (the subtask). When we look at the agile board, the only thing we can see is the status of the subtasks, not of the parent task. It is thus also impossible to drag the parent issue from one column/swimlane to another like we can do with simple issues or subtasks.

Especially when trying to see how far we are in the sprint, it would be good to see in which column/swimlane the parent task would fall. 
I can imagine an indication like the one on the left hand side of the simple issue blocks (a colored bar, depending on the issue type), but horizontal on the bottom of the bar covering all swimlanes. The indication bar would then be displayed over the swimlane the issue is in.
fields.summary: Show parent issue status in Agile board

fields.description:
1. Open Write!.exe
2. Go to Desktop and push combinations of buttons Ctrl+Shift+Esc
3. In Task Manager go to "Процессы"
4. Make sure that the program uses a lot of memory

Exp. result
The program doesn't use a lot of memory
Actual result
The program uses a lot of memory
fields.summary: Write!: the program uses a lot of memory

fields.description: Currently, there are no available gadgets to display Cumulative Flow Diagram and Control Chart report. It would be great if those gadgets are available in user's dashboard.
fields.summary: Make Cumulative Flow Diagram and Control Chart report as dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When '<' or '>' is present in the version name, then it would not be able to be shown properly in the Plan mode of the board

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a board with some issues
# Create a version with '<' or '>' in it, for example, '2>1'
# Set that version as the Fix Version of one of the issues in the board, and this will be the result :
!version1.png|thumbnail!
#* If the version name has a space, it would still be the same :
!version2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional info
This was tested on JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.13
fields.summary: The version doesn't show up properly on the Plan mode if '<' or '>' is present

fields.description: x
fields.summary: x

fields.description:
When setting up JIRA Agile, it is quite common to create test sprints. 

If we delete the test issues that were created, the sprint is still displayed in the report mode, and selecting them a popup says "No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model"

It would be really useful if those sprints were not displayed in the report mode of the boards.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to not view Sprints with no issues in the Agile reports
Incorrect limitations to creating sprints in "Creating a Sprint" documentation

fields.description:
At the moment, when editing the Burndown gadget, users are only able to choose the current active sprint or the *Next sprint due (auto)*.

At times, it would be useful to have the ability to select previously completed sprints as well.
fields.summary: Previous completed sprint for Burndown Gadget

fields.description:
Hi There,

We are currently looking for a functionality under our sprint report to identify "Completed" issues based on issue types and eventually a sum of total "story points" for that issue type.

eg : 
For "Story" type issues , total story points = 67
For "Bug" type issues, total story points = 39

Thanks
fields.summary: Group issues based on issue types in Sprint Report and calculate story points.
